data.title: When changing view position, y_rot is updated to the nearest multiple of 2*Pi instead of 0, reducing spinning
data.body: Extensions to other viewing modes would need to be made as well, as shifting to a side view will still cause spinning.

data.title: Spatial Editor: Camera Y rotation unbounded - causes unnecessary spinning when switching to top/bottom view
data.body:
Using the latest version I have on Windows ( 3.0 Alpha, build from a couple of days ago, build from earlier today had compilation issues but as far as I can tell it's not been changed yet)

**Issue description:**
In editor/plugins/spatial_editor_plugin.cpp, the cursor.x_rot has an enforced bound of Pi and -Pi, but y_rot is allowed to take any value (so it can orbit properly).

As far as I can tell though, no attempt is then made to keep the value between Pi and -Pi after the lerp to the new camera angle has been made. This causes the y_rot to take large values (unbounded). When the perspective is then changed with the top view button or by pressing 7, it then tries to lerp from this large value back down to 0, causing the whole thing to spin like crazy instead of just making the small needed movement.

I tried to make a fix but it's very late here and I figured I would post here before I sleep.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open any 3D scene
Spin around a few times with middle mouse button + move.
Use the top view button/hit 7.

data.body:

Make an error somewhere and then fix the error. The line highlight and the error text will stay and not go away until another error happens.

![](https://i.imgur.com/j56VrNI.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/xQC6y7p.png)

data.title: Can't clear the stream set in AudioPlayerStream
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Mageia 6, current master 

**Issue description:**
Clearing the stream currently set in an AudioStreamPlayer node is impossible.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add an AudioStreamPlayer node in a scene.
Set any stream in the 'stream' variable in the Inspector (New AudioStreamSample for example)
Try to clear it.

**Link to minimal example project:**
No need.

data.title: The camera wiggles back and forth when freelook speed is modulated
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master

Mouse wheel is supposed to modulate speed while using freelook, aside from having a link with orbit zoom.
However, when I do this in the current master it makes the camera wiggle back and forth in unwanted ways.
It worked fine before, so something must have broken the way this is handled...

data.title: Edited shaders don't always update
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master
Windows 10 64 bits nVidia 940M

When editing shaders, I noticed that very often, when I hit Ctrl+S after modifying a shader, nothing happens as if I didn't change it. In these cases I almost always try to write an extra ";", then delete it and re-save with Ctrl+S... and tadaaa, the shader updates.
Did anyone experienced this?

PS: similarly, I see the script editor sometimes gets stuck showing an error with a red highlight even though I corrected the error. Same thing, when I write a character then delete it and re-save to kinda "kick the machine", it updates and the lingering highlight goes away. Would it be the same issue? If not I could open another (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/11616)

data.title: Build MSVC safe_refcount in a separate compilation unit
data.body:
Including windows.h in a globally included header gives all kinds of
issues. Move the MSVC implementation for safe_refcount back into a .cpp
file to prevent this from happening.

This fixes #11602

data.title: Reduce gcc lto build time by telling the linker to use the number of jobs indicated by -j
data.body:
When building with `use_lto=yes`, the option `lto_multiprocess=yes` will tell the linker to use all available cores con the system.
For example, on an i7 740QM this reduces build time by ~9 minutes.
This option is only available for gcc. AFAIK clang doesn't support this feature (someone correct me if I'm wrong).

data.title: Update theme property respectively
data.body:
![theme](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/30857502-e76471f6-a2f6-11e7-8354-1e18a1d77ea8.gif)

- Base color, Accent color, contrast value are updated to match the color theme.
- Preset will be set to "Custom" if any value is changed.
- Default color & contrast value are set to selected preset color theme to revert back easily to last preset color.

data.title: Talking about current EQ and AudioEffectFilters
data.body:
This issue is to talk about the AudioEffectEQ and AudioEffectFilter.

I'm on writting the AudioEffects doc and I need some opinion about the differents Filter effects and EQ :
For now, there is 3 AudioEffects equalizers (EQ6, EQ10 and EQ21) at fixed frequencies without possibility to set the filter type of each. Added to that there is 7 AudioEffects with specific EQ type (BandLimitFilter, BandPassFilter, HighPassFilter...) having one unique frequency. If you want a very fined audio shape you have to add a lot of AudioEffects on a single bus.
I think this system isn't the good way to do this because it can be a mess to use and isn't the standard in other audio Apps.
Better would be to have a "AudioEffectEQParametrable" with configurable frenquency AND filter type, avoiding  the mess of lot of filter like BandLimitFilter, BandPassFilter, HighPassFilter for just one audio bus.

talked about that with @Zylann, @vnen, Masterizer and oneoh on Discord.

Exemple from Reaper :
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7358899/30856890-1b231dd6-a2ba-11e7-84ac-c149eaa4f706.png)

One EQParametric like this with some EQ 6, EQ 10, EQ21 presets can avoid all others Godot EQ.

data.title: Add mouse delta?
data.body:
There is no way that I'm aware of that you can get the mouse delta, for moving things according to mouse motion. Using current_mouse_pos - last_mouse_pos is problematic once the mouse is captured or hits the screen edges. This is how I had to solve it, which is a bit weird: https://www.reddit.com/r/godot/comments/72j6vu/getting_mouse_delta/?st=j81hx23v&sh=fbffabee

Example:
global_position.x += Input.get_mouse_delta().x

data.title: Selecting a Tilemap node and then creating a new scene causes editor to crash
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7
Godot 3.0
Geforce GTX 760

**Issue description:**
When a tilemap is currently selected in the scene tree, attempting to create a new scene, either from the menu or by double clicking a blank area in the scene tabs section, causes the editor to crash without errors.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Download and load attached project
Select the tilemap node
Try to create a new blank scene, editor should crash

**Link to minimal example project:**
[tilemap_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1332796/tilemap_bug.zip)

data.title: Add option to limit export to positive or negitive values
data.body:
Adds POS and NEG as optional second argument values to export.  POS
functions as the range of 0 to int or float max. NEG functions as the
range of int or float min to 0.

feature requested and discussion in #10154

data.title: Fix missing code editor find and replace missing hover icon.
data.body: closes #11341

data.title: Removed most of the custom colors from the interface.
data.body: colors like custom error colors, etc.

data.title: Can't use `node is load(script_path)` construct, worked in 2.1 with `extends`
Instantiating custom class extending another custom class fails
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 17.04, gcc (Ubuntu 6.3.0-12ubuntu2, Godot master f577efd47ed2f0aa801155756e4ba5d5ea2d5f2b

**Issue description:**
Instantiating custom class inheriting another custom class fails with: ``Internal Script Error - opcode #18``


**Steps to reproduce:**
```
class ClassA:
	var x

class ClassB extends ClassA:
	var y

func _ready():
	ClassB.new()

```
@hpvb https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/11518

data.title: "Changes will be lost!" when editing a shader bundled in a material
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master

I saved a shader in a material, and then saved this material for re-use on multiple objects. But when I edit the shader, the editor stops saving my changes and shows me this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30837058-90291be2-a262-11e7-8605-c5cc6e045737.png)

The result of this is that the shader can't be saved anymore.
My expectation here was that editing the same shader reference would update the material resource where it is saved.

Repro:
1) Create a ShaderMaterial
2) Create a Shader within this material
3) Save the material as a file
4) Load the material on a MeshInstance or two
5) Click the material property, then the shader property
6) Notice you can edit the shader, but the editor warns you changes will be lost (and they are)

data.title: Gizmos can't be seen above shader outputting colors > 1
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master
Windows 10 64 bits nVidia 940M

I was fiddling with shaders and noted that in a particular case, gizmos are not visible.
For example here, I get a blue mesh in which gizmos fade completely:
*=> This is because that blue is > 1*
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30837018-37562c44-a262-11e7-807a-f9cde936e7b4.png)

While if I output just the normal blue with different code, gizmos appear on top:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30837032-4eaef560-a262-11e7-9739-ec3e78bda6ef.png)

data.title: Python header generator now generates strings with escape characters.
data.body: This fixes some compile errors when trying to use Visual Studio as the lexer. Even for setups where this does compile, it also seems to correct some rendering issues with people's names with unicode characters such as @zaps166's name.
